captions.text: >>LET'S OFFER ONE MORE ROUND OF APPLAUSE FOR THAT
BEAUTIFUL PERFORMANCE FROM THE STRING QUARTET.
THE MOMENT HAS ARRIVED FOR EACH GRADUATING SENIOR TO COME
AND ACCORDING TO TRADITION, THE NAMES ARE ALWAYS READ BY
THE UNIVERSITY'S FOUNDER, CLARK M. RICHARDS.
>>NO. SHAMOO IS THE NAME OF A WHALE,
WOULDN'T WANT TO BE YOU RIGHT NOW!

comments.author: Paladin585

comments.text:
+absolutetuber  Sounds  like  a  cry  for  attention  to  me.  Were  you  
wanting  to  be  included?  I'm  sure  if  you  came  up  with  a  
reasonable  excuse  to  join  this  conversation  in  a  hostile  way,  I  
could  compliment  you  on  creativity.
comments.author: Paladin585

comments.text: +Paladin585 the youtube-comment-sex you two have going on is pretty hostile.
comments.author: absolutetuber

comments.text:
+absolutetuber  Or  you  could  make  a  coherent  comment.  Finger  
blasting?  And  dude,  this  hasn't  been  hostile  at  all.  So  why  
exactly  is  there  a  need  for  the  post  you  are  making?
comments.author: Paladin585

comments.text:
good grief.  instead of sitting there finger blasting each other why dont 
you two get a room
comments.author: absolutetuber

comments.text:
+TPGFan I completely understand what you mean by that. Its good to see 
comments like the ones above it shows that there are still civilized people 
on YouTube.
comments.author: Quentin Hastings

comments.text:
+Paladin585
That's my biggest problem with typing. You can go back and reword phrases, 
start all over again, but without a face or gestures, it misses out on a 
lot of a face to face conversation's power.
comments.author: TPGFan

comments.text:
+TPGFan  No  problem,  no  offense  taken.  Sorry  if  I  ended  up  
sounding  offended.  It's  hard  to  convey  intention  through  typing,  
lol.  Glad  we  could  resolve  this.
comments.author: Paladin585

comments.text:
+Paladin585
Yea, I may have come across as being rather critical of your comment. I'm 
sorry if that's the case. My intention was not to offend or criticize you 
or your view, though it may have come out that way. I was blunt, and I 
apologize for that. Like I said, I respect your opinion, and was attempting 
to share my view on it in a straightforward way. If you spend your time 
writing essays with high schoolers as your audience you learn to be more 
direct than you would in normal conversation. I may have been so much so 
that I crossed into being something a bit more offensive, or appeared to be 
forcing my views onto you, which was not my intention. To be perfectly 
honest, I agree with your rating of this sketch. It's one of their weaker 
ones. I just often get the impression from posts expressing negativity 
about a sketch that the poster doesn't understand that not all sketches are 
as funny to all people. I see now that you understand that, and apologize 
if my recommendation towards the end of my first post seemed condescending 
or otherwise offensive.

Again, sorry for the bluntness, your opinion is entirely valid, and 
feedback is always good.

Anyway, props to you as well. Youtube has had too many flame wars as is 
because people can't have in-depth conversations or differing opinions 
about anything without resorting to swearing and personal attacks.
comments.author: TPGFan

comments.text:
+Joshua Palmer  lol,  no  worries,  this  is  youtube.  If  I  got  
offended  by  every  other  comment,  I'd  be  here  24/7.  I  appreciate  
the  apology,  unnecessary  though  it  was,  you  don't  often  get  that  
here.
comments.author: Paladin585

comments.text: +Paladin585 I'm sorry if I offended you. I just wasn't in the best mood.
comments.author: Joshua Palmer

comments.text:
+TPGFan  I'm  sure,  I  greatly  enjoy  their  work.  I  am  leaving  
feedback,  my  intended  goal  being  that  Studio  C  might  take  it  
into  consideration.  I  really  wish  people  wouldn't  take  my  
comments  as  attacks  on  people  who  enjoyed  it,  because  if  this  
does  it  for  you,  more  power  to  you.  Studio  C  will  make  there  
own  choice  in  the  end,  and  if  you  like  it  this  way,  leave  
your  own  feedback  and  let  me  leave  mine.

I  do  appreciate  that  you've  been  respectful  in  your  
comment.  It's  hard  to  find  on  Youtube  sometimes,  and  I  like  to  
give  compliment  when  I  see  it.
comments.author: Paladin585

comments.text:
It's entirely possible that you could see the name mess ups coming. That's 
just the way comedy works. Every joke won't be funny to every person. Some 
jokes are just better than others, others are over the head of or too 
similar to other jokes people have seen. It's fine if you don't love every 
single joke of every single sketch. It's normal, in fact. Thanks for 
sharing your opinion, you never know. The cast may read that and take it 
into account next time they make a sketch. In the meantime, there are 
plenty of other sketches by these and other comedians that you can 
entertain yourself with.
comments.author: TPGFan

comments.text:
"haters  gonna  hate"  is  just  code  for  "gonna  ignore  because  I  
don't  like  what  it  says"  isn't  it?

comments.text:
